ARDUINO 2019
1st Cavite Arduino Technology Research Forum
and Exhibit
"Translating Ideas into Innovation"
S.M. Rolle Hall, Cavite State University
Don Severino de las Alas Campus
April 22, 2019

The opening remarks were given by T3 Campus Administrator,
Prof. Noel A Sedigo
Dr. Camilo A. Polinga, Vice President for Academic Affairs
gives an inspirational message to all the participants of the
seminar

Mr. Keno A. Villavecencio (T3 Campus MIS
Officer), Introduced the first keynote
speaker, Mr. Richaard F. Prodigalidad

Mr. Richaard F. Prodigalidad, receives his Certificate of Appreciation
together with Dr. David L Cero , Dean of the College of Engineering and Information, Dr. Camilo A. Polinga, Vice President for Academic Affairs,
and Prof. Noel A Sedigo
T3 Campus Administrator,
Mr. Richaard F. Prodigalidad is a President and CEO of LEENTECH Network Solutions, a company that specializes in mobile application design and
development, digital marketing and consultation, and cloud server and
management solutions

Mr. Mervin A. Boco, receives his Certificate of
Appreciation together with Mr. keno Villavicencio,
Ms. Arlene Estrada and Ms. Pamela Daphne Busog.
Mr. Mervin Boco discussed about an Arduino Local
and International Competitions. He is Robotics
Coordinator of Tagaytay City Science High School
and International and National Robotics
Competitions Champion and Awardee in Australia,
Singapore, Taiwan, Indonesia, and the Philippines

Participating schools and companies featured their
works in the Arduino oral-based and display project
presentation portion.

Keynote speakers and Heads together
with the IT students

TMK sa TMC
Tulong sa Mamamayan ng Komunidad sa Trece Martires City
Theme: Empowering the Unemployed Members of Community Through livelihood Opportunities
Brgy. Osorio, Trece Martires City
November 14-15, 2019 DAY 1
Prepared supplies, program and brochures for the
Participants

Mr. keno A. Villavicencio with his BSIT
Students preparing laptops to assist
participants on making Business cards

Participants filled-out form for
attendance

Faculty members gives the participants
supplies needed for the two days
program

Ms. Desiree Ann Mendoza, welcomed the
participants and leaded the program

Ms. Pamela Daphne Busog, gives an inspirational
message to the participants and introduced the
first keynote speaker, Mr. Keno Villavicencio
Mr. keno Villavicencio discussed the
importance of Business cards when starting a
small business

Mr. keno Villavicencio and with the help of IT
students demonstrated and assisted
participants on making a Business cards.

Participants with their final output on
designing their own business cards

one of the Filipino delicacy ‘’Biko’’
Participants participated on the activity

TMK sa TMC
Tulong sa Mamamayan ng Komunidad sa Trece
Martires City
Theme: Empowering the Unemployed Members of
Community Through livelihood Opportunities
Brgy. Osorio, Trece Martires City
November 14-15, 2019
DAY 2
Ms. Rose Ann Tobias, Leads Day 2 of the program
and discussed the following lectures and
demonstrations

Ms. Cristza d.O Manlapig discussed the
importance of Food Sanitation and Personal
Hygiene

BSHRM Students demonstrated on how to
make baked pudding, they also discussed the
costing of said product

Participants helps on preparation of the
product
Participant’s finished product

Dr. Jessie Anne Demetillo discussed about
the product marketing and online marketing
strategies

Ms. Vienna Mi Feranil discussed the
importance of Bookkeeping and
financial documentation

Ms. Lilian O. Sidamon discussed the basic
accounting of the sample conducted
products

Ms. Kristel Shane Paminter demonstrated
the preparation and ingredients needed on
making Baked Brownies

Participants willingness to participate in the
preparation of an ingredients
Participant’s finished product

Mr. Junie Gaspar, BSBM student shared their idea
on making finished product holder and its costing

Ms. Erika Nery, BSBM student demonstrated
on making product holder

Faculty members together with the
participants

Participants received their Certificate of
Participation on the two days program

Student leaders Interactive Capability
Enhancement Workshop
April 08, 2019

Mr. Niel B. Reyes received his certificate as as one of the
keynote speaker. He discussed about the Character
Formation for student Leaders

Workshop on Strategic Proposal
Preparation
Team Building Activities

Student Organizations received their
Certificate of Participation

Mr. Gideon Luke P. Ty who leads Awarding of
Ceremony

Student Organizations together with
Mr. Gideon Luke Ty, CSG Adviser and
Mr. Keno Villavicencio, CvSU T3
Campuses MIS Officer

Pre-employment Orientation Seminar 2019
‘’Understanding Career Opportunities: A Big Step to Start your Future’’
April 1, 2019 SM Rolle Hall
CvSU-Don Severino de las Alas Campus
Prof. Noel A Sedigo , T3 Campus Administrator gives an
inspirational message to all the participants of the seminar
Mr. Gerald Boridas and Francheska Maureen Castro,
rd Masters of Ceremony from 3 year BSHRM students
warmly welcome the participants, guest speakers and
faculty members

Mr. Keno A. Villavicencio gives a motivational
message for all the participants

Ms. Ruth Arevalo, from the Department of Labor and
Employment talks about the benefits of being employed
Ms. Lilian Sidamon, Ms. Vienna Mi Feranil and Mr. Aldrin Roderos
give the certificate of appreciation to Ms. Ruth Arevalo

Mr. Philip Azur from VXI Global Holdings B.V. gives an insight
about their company
Mr. Joshua Pascual, one of the guest speakers, talks about
Human Resource Management and explains related topics

Giving of Certificate of Appreciation to the
guest speakers

Project ISIPS (Instensifying Students (and
Teachers') Innovative Power and Skills
through Arduino Technology
September 12-13, 2019
Manpower Building, General Trias, Cavite

Students and Teachers actively participated on the
training program with the assistance of Mr. Keno A.
Villavicencio, MIS Officer of CvSU T3 Campus and
also with the help of his BSIT students
